issues.title: Truncating Sec-Content-Origin hash in transfer requests
issues.author: martinthomson
issues.body:
This will complicate encoding, but it might reduce the entropy that is carried from the user agent to the target origin.  The server would then have to offer all of the options that match for the transfer to complete successfully.

It should be fairly easy to work out a number of bits that might disambiguate sufficiently.  Especially given that the transfer target URL scopes the request considerably.  If you were prepared to place more load on the URL, as little as a single octet could be enough to disambiguate multiple content versions.

issues.title: Confusing statement in Communication Between Origins section
issues.author: sideshowbarker
issues.body:
https://martinthomson.github.io/wpack-content/draft-thomson-wpack-content-origin.html#section-5.6

> This means that communication is only possible if the frame in which the content is loaded by the origin attempting communication, or the content is known to that origin.

A “then [*something*]” expectation is created by the word *if* in the condition *if the frame in which the content is loaded by the origin attempting communication*, but there’s no “something” there.

Or maybe the word *if* is a typo, and some other word was intended there?

comments.author: martinthomson
comments.body:
Thanks for reading.  This is clearly not my best work, but I think that the sentence is complete.

The "then [something]" consequence is "communication is only possible" with a condition being that the "frame is loaded by the origin attempting communication, or ...".

comments.author: sideshowbarker
comments.body:
Sorry, I think I’m still failing to parse it. Lemme try some rewordings to see if I understand —

“This means that communication is only possible if the frame in which the content is *is* loaded by the origin attempting communication”

…that is, add an additional “is” there.

Or maybe this:

“This means that communication is only possible if the frame *containing* the content is loaded by the origin attempting communication”

comments.author: martinthomson
comments.body: Thanks, that helps a lot. I'll make the change you suggest.
